RECORD.TEXT: 626884358 CTMC 45413045 Discharge Summary Unsigned 10/09/1991 Unsigned Discharge Date : PRINCIPLE DIAGNOSIS : HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient is a 58-year-old gravida III , para III massively obese white female with Stage II-A adenocarcinoma of the endometrium who was admitted for placement of a vaginal cylinder . In 04/91 , the patient developed post menopausal bleeding . Physical examination was consistent with clinical Stage I-A disease . Preoperative liver function tests were negative except for an elevated alkaline phosphatase and LDH . Histology showed a well differentiated minimally invasive adenocarcinoma of the endometrium , Grade I / III . The tubes , ovaries , omentum and cytology were all negative . She therefore had pathologic Stage II-A disease . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Hypertension . Paralyzed right arm since birth . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY : Status post appendectomy . MEDICATIONS : On admission included a diuretic and antihypertensive . ALLERGIES : ASPIRIN CAUSES HAND SWELLING AND A RASH . On admission revealed a massively obese white female in no acute distress . There was no palpable lymphadenopathy . There was fungal infection under the large abdominal pannus . Pelvic exam showed normal external genitalia . There was a well healed vaginal cuff . There were no palpable abnormalities on rectovaginal exam . HOSPITAL COURSE : A CC WANG vaginal cylinder was placed in the Radiotherapy Department without difficulty . The patient tolerated her admission well . On 10/11/91 , the implant was removed without difficulty . The patient was discharged to home in good condition . DISPOSITION : She will see Dr. Goodpasture in follow-up in two weeks . D : 10/11/91 Report : T : Columbus Day Dicatated By : cc : 1. CA SHUFF , M.D.
